text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The 1997/8 draft state budget totals 85 billion pounds ($25 billion), seven billion over this year's budget. The draft budget will be referred to parliament by May 1.

- Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak's political adviser, Usama el-Baz, says that Israel will lose if the peace process fails. Baz adds in published statements that the Oslo agreement is the base for the process.
- A large oil discovery was found in the Western Desert. The new well at Badr ed-Din field produces at an unprecedented level of 16,500 barrels per day.
- Prime Minister Kamal Ganzouri meets with members of the economic delegation, who will accompany him to a ten-day tour of three Asian countries. Ganzouri starts the tour tomorrow.
- Supply and Trade Minister Ahmed Gueily is expected to issue this week a decision setting quotas for imported steel products.

- Foreign Minister Amr Moussa flies tomorrow to Malta to head Egypt's delegation to the European-Mediterranean foreign ministers meeting. The meeting will discuss cooperation programmes between the two parties and creating a free trade zone in the region by the year 2010.
